title: Someone has claimed £170,000,000 EuroMillions jackpot
text:
But who is the lucky winner and will we ever know? (Picture: Rex)

A lucky lottery player has come forward to claim their record EuroMillions jackpot prize of £170 million – the country’s biggest ever winner.

National Lottery operator Camelot announced on Thursday that a ticket holder has finally claimed their historic win.

Following the longest-ever series of rollovers, the punter matched all five main numbers – 07, 10, 15, 44, 49 – along with the two lucky stars – 03 and 12 in Tuesday’s draw.

Their ‘life-changing win’ will see them take home an incredible £170,221,000.

But it is yet to be revealed who the very lucky winner is and we will only find out if they decide to go public, said Camelot.

The operator added there would be no information available on whether the winner was an individual or a syndicate, and where the special ticket was bought, unless the holder decides to reveal themself to the nation.

Andy Carter, senior winners adviser at the National Lottery, said: ‘This is the biggest win ever on The National Lottery and we look forward to helping the ticket-holder start to enjoy their new-found wealth.’

Colin and Chris Weir were the UK’s previous biggest winners, taking home £161 million in 2011 (Picture: Rex)

The prize will be paid out at a ticket validation appointment and the ticket-holder would then decide whether or not to remain anonymous.

While Camelot said the decision was always up to the winner, it said many found going public helped the news to ‘sink in’ and allowed them to enjoy their money without worrying how to explain where it came from.

Mr Carter added: ‘As always, the team are on hand to support and help guide the new winner as they start their adventure with their life-changing win.’

A £123 million winner in June has never revealed their identity and Camelot would not give any further details about them.

The previous biggest UK winners were Colin and Chris Weir, from Largs in North Ayrshire, Scotland, who won £161 million in July, 2011.

Patrick and Frances Connolly won a £114.9 million jackpot on New Year’s Day (Picture: Philip Magowan/PressEye)

It has been a particularly successful year for Britons in the EuroMillions this year, with several big wins claimed.

In the New Year’s Day draw, Patrick and Frances Connolly, from Northern Ireland, won the £114.9 million jackpot.

Ade Goodchild landed a £71 million prize in March, while another anonymous ticket-holder bagged £35.2 million in April.

Meanwhile, another Briton won £1 million in the Millionaire Maker Selection game on Tuesday.

description: A winner of the National Lottery EuroMillions prize has come forward, said Camelot.
